text: This seems like best option for electronics: <http://www.pibot.com/set-of-pibot-electronics-kits-for-cnc-2-0-c.html>

attachments.title: A Set of PiBot Electronics Kits 2.0C for CNC (Free Shipping by DHL)
attachments.text: You can build 3 Axizs CNC Router with this electronics kits, such as build with openbuilds kits.
attachments.fallback: English: A Set of PiBot Electronics Kits 2.0C for CNC (Free Shipping by DHL)

text: Openbuild's CNC xPRO controller uses DRV8825 which are a little underpowered for nema23s. Similar goes or Smoothieboard. TinyG seems OK, but not compared to the PiBot for price.
PiBot Runs GBRL which seems to be go-to for open source CNC stuff.
Alternatively you can get this board for dirt cheap and use DRV8825s I have lying around and a Arduino Uno. <http://www.ebay.com/itm/261513306776>

attachments.title: CNC Shield V3.0 GRBL compatible Pololu A4988 driver for Arduino
attachments.text: GRBL 0.8c compatible. (Open source firmware that runs on an Arduino UNO that turns G-code commands into stepper signals). Uses removable Pololu A4988 compatible stepper drivers. (A4988, DRV8825 and others). | eBay!
attachments.fallback: eBay: CNC Shield V3.0 GRBL compatible Pololu A4988 driver for Arduino
